Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a thick-walled red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.220)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36513) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36513)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 384 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
